ie.wit.service.access

Class JwtService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.wit.service.access.JwtService

  • @Service
class JwtService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class generates JWT's and also validates them
    Author:
    Joe Wemyss

        Validate if the user is an admin

      • getUsernameAndRole

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUsernameAndRole(java.lang.String jwt)
        return the username and the role of the user that the jwt was issued to
        Parameters:
        jwt - the JWT to be parsed
        Returns:
        a map containing the username, with key "user", and the role, with key "role"

      • checkClaims

        private boolean checkClaims(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> expected)
        This method wil check the validity of the claims contained in the JWT.
        Parameters:
        claims - This will be the claims to be checked.
        expected - This will be a Map of the expected values that will correspond with the claims
        Returns:
        true if all of the claims match, false otherwise

      • isJwtValid

        private boolean isJwtValid(java.lang.String jwt)
        Check the validity of the passed JWT. .
        Parameters:
        jwt - the JWT to be verified
        Returns:
        true if it is a valid JWT, false otherwise

      • checkJwtTime

        private boolean checkJwtTime(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims)
        Check if a JWT is expired or sent before it is allowed.
        Parameters:
        claims - the claims contained in the JWT
        Returns:
        true if the JWT is within the time constraints, false otherwise

        private io.jsonwebtoken.Claims parseJwt(java.lang.String jwt)
        Gather the claims from the JWT
        Parameters:
        jwt - the jwt that the claims should be gathered from
        Returns:
